visualization_prompt: Generate a column chart showing the percentage contribution of nuclear versus renewable energy sources across top electricity-producing countries using stacked percentage columns with domain-appropriate categorical labels

title.text: Top 10 Nuclear vs Renewable Energy Producers (2011)

visualization_explanation: The dataset contains three-dimensional energy production data across 10 categorical entities (countries). Numerical variables represent percentage contributions of three energy sources (μ=15.2, σ=18.6), exhibiting right-skewed distribution with nuclear energy showing highest variance (σ=23.1). Source data from Wikipedia demonstrates face validity through country-specific patterns like France's nuclear dominance (79.4%). The stacked column chart maximizes data-ink ratio by using position and color encoding simultaneously. Cairo's principles of salience are implemented through chromatic contrast (#01BAF2 vs #FFA500) and proportional stacking. Percentage normalization enables direct comparison of energy mix composition across heterogeneous total production countries. Statistical coherence is maintained through constrained value ranges (0-100%) and monotonic distribution patterns in nuclear adoption.
